DMITRI-001.title: Premature Class-Level Caching
DMITRI-001.notes: Cache simplified to single Dict[str, Dict] keyed by resolved path. While I still maintain full removal would be cleaner, the current implementation is reasonable: (1) single cache variable, (2) clear comments explaining thread-safety rationale, (3) idempotent reads. The pragmatist in me says: it works, it's documented, move on.

DMITRI-002.title: Hardcoded Component Keywords Dictionary
DMITRI-002.notes: Documentation added at lines 1100-1111 explaining each internal codename. This is better than externalizing to YAML for now - the mapping is domain knowledge that needs to live somewhere, and inline comments make it discoverable. External config would add another file to maintain.

DMITRI-003.title: Dual Timing Metrics Unused
DMITRI-003.notes: Not addressed, but original severity was LOW. Timing metrics in SyncResult (fetch_duration_ms, pull_duration_ms) remain separate. If a dashboard needs this later, it's available. If not, no harm done.

DMITRI-004.title: Multiple Path Resolution for Non-Existent Scenario
DMITRI-004.notes: YAGNI second path (REPO_BASE_PATH / 'FeedForward') removed. Line 1050 now uses single path: Path(__file__).parent.parent.parent.parent / 'docs' / 'tailwind-codebase-map.md'. Clean and correct.

GIT_TIMEOUT_SECONDS_constant.notes: Magic number 30 extracted to named constant. Used in lines 223, 248, 288. This is the right level of configuration - not over-engineered into a config file, just a clear constant.

MIN_COMPONENT_LENGTH_FOR_PARTIAL_MATCH_c.notes: Extracted magic number 3 to constant. Used in line 1212. Documents intent clearly.

codename_documentation.notes: Each internal codename now has explanation. Future maintainer can understand why 'swanson' maps to billing. This is documentation that earns its keep.

positives.description: Fixes addressed the spirit of the issues without over-correcting into new complexity
Constants extracted with clear names, not buried in a separate config module
Second path removal shows willingness to delete code that serves no purpose

summary.notes: DMITRI-001 and DMITRI-002 were addressed with reasonable simplifications rather than full rewrites. DMITRI-003 (LOW) deferred - acceptable. DMITRI-004 fixed completely. No new complexity introduced. The code is cleaner than Round 1.

verdict: LGTM. The pragmatist approach was followed: fix what matters, document what remains, don't gold-plate. The cache stays but is simpler. The keywords stay but are documented. The unnecessary second path is gone. Ship it.
